name: Plaza de África
excerpt: This is the charming heart of Ceuta, with manicured tropical plantings, a square of freshly renovated cobblestone pathways and some of the city’s finest…
detail_description:
This is the charming heart of Ceuta, with manicured tropical plantings, a square of freshly renovated cobblestone pathways and some of the city’s finest architecture.
Moving clockwise from the oblong Commandancia General, a military headquarters closed to visitors, you encounter the striking yellow Santuario de Nuestra Señora de África, the 19th-century Palacio de la Asamblea, and finally the Cathedral Santa Maria de la Asunción with its museum. The centre of the plaza contains a memorial to soldiers lost in the Spanish-Moroccan War of 1860, a conflict over the borders of Ceuta.

name: Museo de Ceuta
excerpt: This ageing municipal museum has a small collection showing the peninsula’s pre-Spanish history, with all labels in Spanish. The temporary exhibitions are…
detail_description: This ageing municipal museum has a small collection showing the peninsula’s pre-Spanish history, with all labels in Spanish. The temporary exhibitions are of more interest.

name: Playa del Chorillo
excerpt: The bigger of Ceuta's two beaches, Playa del Chorillo is a little further from the city centre, but it's only slightly less busy. The water is a…
detail_description: The bigger of Ceuta's two beaches, Playa del Chorillo is a little further from the city centre, but it's only slightly less busy. The water is a magnificent blue, but unfortunately, the sand is a bland grey.

name: Playa de la Ribera
excerpt: Ceuta's urban beach is jam-packed during summer with nearly nude Spaniards and fully clothed Moroccan women. The beach is lined with cafes and bars…
detail_description: Ceuta's urban beach is jam-packed during summer with nearly nude Spaniards and fully clothed Moroccan women. The beach is lined with cafes and bars perfect for whiling away an afternoon with a cerveza.

name: Palacio de la Asamblea
excerpt: A striking early 20th-century building with an elegant dome and clock that has served as both a palace and city hall. Inside, find paintings and sketches…
detail_description: A striking early 20th-century building with an elegant dome and clock that has served as both a palace and city hall. Inside, find paintings and sketches by Mariano Bertuchi, the Ceuta native who went on to make a major impact both at home and in Tetouan.

name: Catedral Santa Maria de la Asunción
excerpt: The yellow-and-white cathedral overlooking Plaza de África is the finest church in Ceuta, with twin spires that host matching bells. At nightfall, the…
detail_description: The yellow-and-white cathedral overlooking Plaza de África is the finest church in Ceuta, with twin spires that host matching bells. At nightfall, the spire's domed tips glow red. The small museum contains artefacts dating back to the 15th century, including a couple of gleaming silver sceptres.

name: Santuario de Nuestra Señora de África
excerpt: The striking yellow 17th-century baroque-style church in Plaza de África remains active among Ceuta's Roman Catholic faithful. The altar has a powerful…
detail_description: The striking yellow 17th-century baroque-style church in Plaza de África remains active among Ceuta's Roman Catholic faithful. The altar has a powerful painting of the Lady of Africa with Jesus Christ lying dead in her arms. Feel free to walk around in silence as long as there's no service going on.

name: Baños Arabes
excerpt: Accidentally discovered during street work, these ancient Arab hammams sit on a main road, an incongruous sight. There are two of them, with barrel…
detail_description: Accidentally discovered during street work, these ancient Arab hammams sit on a main road, an incongruous sight. There are two of them, with barrel-vaulted roofs originally covered with marble – the high-tech spa of its time. You can do a lap around the historic building, but it isn't open to the public.

name: Museo Histórico Militar
excerpt: Named after a noseless pirate who landed here in 1417, Ceuta's Desnarigado military museum is jam-packed with memorabilia from Ceuta's many battles. An…
detail_description: Named after a noseless pirate who landed here in 1417, Ceuta's Desnarigado military museum is jam-packed with memorabilia from Ceuta's many battles. An Arab cast-iron cannon engraved in 1635 is a standout, as are German bazookas, WWI cavalry gear and Ceuta's first computer. There is a lighthouse above and a secluded beach below.

name: Museo de la Basilica Tardorromana
excerpt: This superbly executed underground museum is integrated into the architectural remains of an ancient basilica discovered during street work in the 1980s,…
detail_description: This superbly executed underground museum is integrated into the architectural remains of an ancient basilica discovered during street work in the 1980s, including a bridge over open tombs, skeletons included. The artefacts become a means of branching out into various elements of local history. In Spanish, but definitely worth a lap through.

name: Casa de los Dragones
excerpt: The Casa de los Dragones on Plaza de los Reyes is a fantastic dream that has entered the real world. This former home is an extraordinary example of…

name: Mirador de Isabel II
excerpt: This is the best view in Ceuta, overlooking the city and the Strait of Gibraltar, where the Atlantic and Mediterranean meet. Locals come to picnic on…

name: Museo de los Muralles Reales
excerpt: This two-floor gallery houses temporary art exhibitions lasting four years each. Squeezed out of the fort's unforgiving architecture, it's a beautifully…

name: Plaza de los Reyes
excerpt: With its green triumphal arch (inscribed ‘a monument to coexistence’) and fountain, this plaza borders the twin-towered yellow Iglesia de San Francisco…

name: Parque Marítimo del Mediterráneo
excerpt: This creative maritime park is a real hit in the summer and perfect for families. One of several parks developed by the artist and architect César…

name: Museo de la Legión
excerpt: This intriguing museum is dedicated to and run by the Spanish Legion, an army unit set up in 1920 that played a pivotal role in Franco’s republican army…

name: Murallas Reales
excerpt: The most impressive sight in Ceuta is the medieval Royal Walls, which date back over 1000 years and have been passed from Arab to Portuguese to Spanish…
